lead_paragraph: Terrorism experts said today that Peru dismissed several well-executed attacks in the last year and ignored warnings that foreshadowed the commando-style takeover of the Japanese ambassador's house, where guerrillas are holding several hundred hostages. The experts said the warnings had come from a range of sources: captured documents indicating plans for raids on official targets and intelligence from academics and law enforcement officials as well as informants in contact with guerrilla groups.

headline.main: Peru Shrugged Off Warnings Of Rebel Attack, Experts Say

abstract: Terrorism experts say that Peru dismissed several well-executed attacks in last year and ignored warnings that foreshadowed commando-style takeover of Japanese ambassador's house, where guerrillas are holding several hundred hostages; say Government security forces, convinced they had won war against terrorism after years of success, have been devoting their limited resources to other threats; Enrique Obando, considered foremost authority on terrorism and military in Peru, says 'security forces were sloppy and overconfident'; photo (M)
